Administration.text:
Type: Bisphosphonate
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: IV
Common Trade Names:

Lactation_risk.text: No information available, avoid use or breastfeeding

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult:
CrCl 50-60 mL/min: 3.5 mg
CrCl 40-49 mL/min: 3.3 mg
CrCl 30-39 mL/min: 3 mg
CrCl <30 mL/min: Not recommended

Lactation_risk.text: No information available, avoid use or breastfeeding

Adult:
CrCl 50-60 mL/min: 3.5 mg

CrCl 30-39 mL/min: 3 mg
CrCl <30 mL/min: Not recommended

Adult:
CrCl 50-60 mL/min: 3.5 mg
CrCl 40-49 mL/min: 3.3 mg
CrCl 30-39 mL/min: 3 mg
CrCl <30 mL/min: Not recommended

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Hypocalcemia
Severe renal impairment (CrCl <35 mL/min or evidence of acute renal impairment)
Rehydrate hypovolemic patients prior to administration

Serious.text:
Hypocalcemia
Bronchoconstriction if aspirin-sensitive asthma
Osteonecrosis (usually of jaw)
Acquired fanconi syndrome
Hypotension

Common.text:
Bone pain, arthralgia
Nausea/vomiting, constipation, diarrhea
Fever
Fatigue, insomnia, anxiety
Anemia
Dyspnea
Headache, dizziness
UTI
Hypophosphatemia, hypokalemia, hypomagnesemia
Rash

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 146h
Metabolism: Not metabolized
Excretion: Urinary

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Acts on osteoclasts to inhibit bone resorption
